name: 鍾孟雲
objective:
　　Course Title: Electronics I
　　Description: Introduce the composition, characteristics and applications of electronic components. Enable students to have the ability to analyze, simulate, design and apply practical circuits. The content covers: 1. Semiconductor physics, 2. Basic active components (diodes, bipolar transistors, field effect transistors), 3. Amplifier circuits, 4. Logic (digital) circuit, 5. Integrated circuit.
schedule:
Week 1. 　　Introduction of the course and microelectronic circuit
Week 2. 　　Electronics and Semiconductors (1)
Week 3. 　　Electronics and Semiconductors (2)
Week 4. 　　Operational Amplifiers (1) 
Week 5. 　　Operational Amplifiers (2)
Week 6. 　　Operational Amplifiers (3)
Week 7. 　　Diodes (1) 
Week 8. 　　Diodes (2)
Week 9. 　　Midterm exam.
Week 10. 　　Bipolar Junction Transistors (1)
Week 11. 　　Bipolar Junction Transistors (2)
Week 12. 　　MOS Field-Effect Transistors (1)
Week 13. 　　MOS Field-Effect Transistors (2)
Week 14. 　　Transistor Amplifiers (1) 
Week 15. 　　Transistor Amplifiers (2)
Week 16. 　　Transistor Amplifiers (3)
Week 17. 　　Theme reports
Week 18. 　　Final exam. 
(course will be adjusted according to the progress.)
scorePolicy:
Mid-term exams: 30%
Final exams: 30%
Attendance: 25%
Theme Reports: 15%
materials:
Sedra & Smith, ”Microelectronic circuits”, OXFORD PRESS, 8th Edition, 2021.

Donald A. Nearmen, ”Microelectronic circuits Analysis and Design”, 4th Edition, 2019.
